title: emails in my inbox self delete
content:
I have delayed replying because the fault seems to have corrected itself and I was waiting to see what happened next. When I go to my phone and go to the Gmail route, I find a message "unable to connect", so it appears that the fault is somehow "blocked".

Many thanks to those that helped, particularly Toad Hall and for your patience.

C R Thompson.
creator: Beac0n

title: Merge Contacts from phone to PC thunderbird 102.11.0 or visa versa without duplicates
content: With the main form of email today is on the Phone, the number One concern is Contacts. Using an office computer requires those contacts to be accurate on both systems and updated in the back ground. Use of Google to do this is out of the question due to the lack of Groups or it's called Label. An organizational field like Doctors or Customer service. I notice some these fields on my phone contact are nonexistent on Thunderbird contacts. Why? I thought it was converted to VCard format with contains many more fields. Editing a Contact only shows a minimal number of fields compared to VCard. CardDAV just looks confusing and I can't tell what is what, and causes duplicates. So why is there no merge without duplicates if the same Name field is already on file. I've tried to use tools like BirdieSync, but it just duplicates every dam contact causing a mess. This is really a problem because computers are here to make life better not add more work. So, before I get rid of TB just what is down the road for this problem? My phone Contact software should have a APP that connects to my PC and copies new contacts or updates contacts to the Thunderbird contacts and visa versa. If they are both using VCard what's the problem? PC to Phone and phone to PC, without Google or Microsoft data theft of my contacts. Any Ideas?
creator: bmazak

title: Major vs minor updates
content:
I get notification with a popup every time TB has any minor update. The difference between 102.10.0 versus 102.10.04 is negligible. even the current 102.10.0 versus 102.12.0 is not worth the bother. However, every time I start TB it pops up the annoying sign I have to dismiss.

The next major update is soon and will be Thunderbird 115, codename Supernova, in July 2023 Thunderbird 115, codename Supernova, in July 2023.

I seem to remember a method in Firefox config that allows for ignoring all but major updates. Can anyone tell us how to do it either FF or TB?
creator: atsdon1

title: Installed Thunderbird 102.12.0 and am Unable to see any Calendar Events
content:
I just today (6/27/2023) downloaded and Installed Thunderbird on my Mac (latest OS installed).

I was able to successfully configure my Google account email and my company's Outlook/Exchange email just fine and I'm getting messages on both.

However, I do not see ANY calendar events whatsoever...not Apple (local) or Outlook.

I seem to be able to create an event on the calendar that's showing, but I'm getting nothing from Apple or Outlook.

I'm not so worried about local or Apple events, but I DO want to see my company's events that are on the Outlook Catalog.

Any ideas?

Thanks in advance!

Korky Kathman
creator: kkathman1
